revised_title: New Sources of Ethyl- and Methyl-Aniline: Extraction from Hofmann Gum
tldr: The authors discover that Hofmann gum, a waste byproduct in the production of aniline dyes, contains a large quantity of methyl-aniline and ethyl-aniline that can be extracted through destructive distillation. This finding offers an economical method for producing these chemicals.
